duties_responsibilities.duty: Conduct internal audits of client records to ensure compliance with funder requirements.
Provide leadership, supervision, and evaluation for all program staff in the Quality Assurance department.
Develop and provide training to new and experienced staff, individually and in groups.
Manage internal audits of client records to ensure accuracy, consistency, and attainment of all funder requirements.
Oversee and conduct follow-up reviews to ensure correction of chart and documentation deficiencies by program staff.
Manage the preparation for audits and site visits, and attend programmatic meetings to enhance understanding of program operations.
Serve as a knowledge expert for less experienced quality assurance staff members.
Design department policy and procedure that enhances program efficiency, builds a culture of compliance, and ensures all funder requirements are monitored and met.

education_certification.credential: Four (4) years of quality assurance experience OR equivalent combination of training and experience. Bachelor's degree in a related field (Master's preferred).
